content.description: In a certain game, a player may have the opportunity to attempt a bonus round to earn extra points. In a typical game, a player is given 1 to 4 bonus round attempts. For each attempt, the player typically earns the extra points 70% of the time and does not earn the extra points 30% of the time.
content.question: The following code segment can be used to simulate the bonus round. Which of the following is NOT a possible output of this simulation?

choices.label: The player had 1 bonus round attempts and 1 of them earned extra points.
The player had 2 bonus round attempts and 0 of them earned extra points.
The player had 3 bonus round attempts and 7 of them earned extra points.
The player had 4 bonus round attempts and 3 of them earned extra points.

content.answer: The player had 3 bonus round attempts and 7 of them earned extra points.

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Determine the result of code segments.
